In study propose test follow patient CAD : - Determine whether experience assess randomly throughout day associate change blood supply heart muscle measure electrical recording chest . - Determine whether typical daily experience associate change recovery time portion heart beat cycle measure electrical recording chest . - Determine whether change recovery time portion heart beat cycle associate typical daily experience occur exclusively change blood supply heart muscle . - Determine whether typical daily experience influence blood supply recovery time base severity presence CAD ( compare CAD patient healthy subject ) .
DOC.criteria: KEY INCLUSION CRITERIA : LOW RISK CAD SUBJECTS , EJECTION FRACTION > 35 % Proficient English At least 21 year age older Stable coronary artery disease Willing participant 3 day Holter monitor recording respond survey study provide smartphone KEY EXCLUSION CRITERIA : LOW RISK CAD SUBJECTS Presence bundle branch block evident ECG KEY INCLUSION CRITERIA : HIGH RISK CAD Subjects , Ejection Fraction < 35 % Proficient English 21 year age old Have stable coronary artery disease document previous myocardial infarction Recent ECHO , MUGA angiography ( < 5year old ) reflect leftventricular ejection fraction < 35 % Single dual chamber ICD , back rate ventricular pace < 45 bpm Willing wear Holter monitor 3 day respond survey study provide smartphone KEY EXCLUSION CRITERIA : HIGH RISK CAD , Ejection Fraction < 35 % An implanted cardiac resynchronization pacemaker ICD ( CRTD ) Heart rhythm artificially continuously pace Presence bundle branch block evident ECG KEY INCLUSION CRITERIA : OLDER HEALTHY COMPARISON Proficient English 51 year age old No history evidence ischemic heart disease Normal screen ECG without evidence rhythm abnormality , conduction abnormality , hypertrophy , pathology Age match within 5 year CAD patient Negative treadmill/bicycle exercise test Willing wear Holter monitor 3 day respond survey study provide smartphone KEY EXCLUSION CRITERIA : OLDER HEALTHY COMPARISON History ischemic heart disease ( CAD ) , prior myocardial infarction History cardiac disease KEY INCLUSION CRITERIA : YOUNGER HEALTHY ( ENROLLMENT CLOSED ) Proficient English 21 50 year age Normal screen ECG without evidence rhythm abnormality , conduction abnormality , hypertrophy , pathology Willing wear Holter monitor 3 day respond survey study provide smartphone KEY EXCLUSION CRITERIA : YOUNGER HEALTHY History ischemic heart disease ( CAD ) , prior myocardial infarction History cardiac diseases Abnormal ECG
